descriptions: Student does not identify any coping strategies.
Student identifies one coping strategy, but it is not effective or appropriate.
Student identifies one coping strategy that is somewhat effective, but lacks detail.
Student identifies two or more coping strategies, but some may not be fully effective.
Student identifies multiple effective coping strategies with some explanation.
Student identifies and clearly explains multiple effective and appropriate coping strategies.
Student does not apply coping strategies to given scenarios.
Student attempts to apply a coping strategy, but it is not relevant to the scenario.
Student applies a coping strategy that is somewhat relevant, but explanation is vague.
Student applies coping strategies to scenarios with some relevance and explanation.
Student effectively applies coping strategies to scenarios with clear and logical explanations.
Student expertly applies and justifies multiple coping strategies to diverse scenarios with thorough and insightful explanations.
Student demonstrates no understanding of the consequences of not using coping strategies.
Student shows a limited understanding of the negative consequences.
Student acknowledges some negative consequences but lacks depth.
Student understands several consequences with some explanation.
Student clearly articulates the consequences of substance abuse and the benefits of coping strategies.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of short-term and long-term consequences, including physical, emotional, and social impacts.
